pr_title: Add a generic type for the key on the ImmutableKeyValuePairs.

timeline.bodyText: I think for these sort of interfaces, at least until we're on Java 8 someday, we can add a comment like. This is a FunctionalInterface and will not have methods added to it - it is safe to use as a lambda without chance of API breakage. The reason we don't add the annotation is we target Java 7.
timeline.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: A good point. But, if I'm going ahead with changing the API for #1580 , this one won't be so nice and simple any more, but have lots of methods on it. The LabelConsumer is a different story, though, as I think it will stay simple.

replies.bodyText: I added some javadoc here. Let me know what you think.
replies.author: jkwatson

timeline.bodyText: I don't quite follow the PR description about clashing with Map - we don't inherit from Map so there's no clash right?
timeline.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: The issue is with the AttributeMap used in the RecordEventsReadableSpan. It does extend Map, and the get method on Map clashes with what this has now.
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: I updated the PR description with some details that I realized was missing for people other than me. :)
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: Maybe a better answer is to finally rip off the bandaid, and make the AttributesMap not extend HashMap.
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: @anuraaga I made AttributesMap not extend HashMap anymore, and restored the get name. Please take a look!
replies.author: jkwatson

timeline.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: This will be needed when we switch the key type, since they won't be strings any more. The prototype didn't mess with the underlying implementation, but just stuck with Maps for demo simplicity (note the TODOs in the prototype code).
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: I updated the PR description with some details that I realized was missing for people other than me. :)
replies.author: jkwatson

timeline.message: Add some javadoc to the new interfaces.

Add a generic type for the key on the ImmutableKeyValuePairs.
This necessitated changing the `get` to `getValue` to avoid clashing with the java.util.Map interface.
Also introduced convenience sub-interfaces for consuming labels and attributes, so consumers don't have to worry about the types if they don't want to.
Add some javadoc to the new interfaces.
Make AttributesMap not extend map, and restore the get method name for Attributes.
Make AttributesMap not extend map, and restore the get method name for Attributes.
make ImmutableKeyValuePairs also have a parameterized key type

timeline.bodyText: I think it's worth returning the existing item like Map since it's familiar and opens more use cases without extra work. It's not backwards-compatible to change return value of a method unfortunately.
timeline.author: anuraaga

replies.bodyText: That's fair. I'll make it so.
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: although, this is an internal, non-public class, so I don't think it actually matters much. :)
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: Oops haha. Yeah then no worries at all
replies.author: anuraaga

timeline.author: anuraaga
